intro: Woodia verruculosa, commonly known as the rough woodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Woodia verruculosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
